qas.question: Every rural district is subdivided into what?
Every urban district is what in its own right?
What is the smallest administrative unit in Germany?
What are only rural districts divided into?
What are urban districts not allowed to be?
How many districts are there in Germany?
What rights do cities and towns give up if they are a municipality?

plausible_answers.text: the right to impose local taxes or to allow industry only within city limits

qas.question: What special rights does a city have nowadays along with the right to be called a city?

context: Municipalities (Gemeinden): Every rural district and every Amt is subdivided into <a0_0><b5_0>municipalities<b5_0/><a0_0/>, while every urban district is <a3_0>a <a1_0><b6_0>municipality<a3_0/><a1_0/> in its own right<b6_0/>. There are (as of 6 March 2009[update]) <a2_0><b7_0>12,141<b7_0/><a2_0/> municipalities, which are the smallest administrative units in Germany. Cities and towns are municipalities as well, also having <b8_0>city rights or town rights<b8_0/> (<a4_0>Stadtrechte<a4_0/>). Nowadays, this is mostly just the right to be called a city or town. However, in former times there were many other privileges, including <b9_0>the right to impose local taxes or to allow industry only within city limits<b9_0/>.
